intro: Anemopaegma brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Anemopaegma brevipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
